meanings.definition: An excessive or dangerous amount of a substance taken or administered.
meanings.sent1: The doctor warned about the risks of overdosage of the medication.
meanings.sent2: She experienced overdosage after mistakenly taking too many pills.
meanings.sent3: The comedy skit humorously portrayed a character dealing with overdosage of caffeine.
meanings.sent4: His obsession with perfection led to an overdosage of self-criticism.
meanings.sent5: The news report highlighted the importance of recognizing the signs of overdosage in patients.

meanings.definition: The act of taking or administering too much of a substance.
meanings.sent1: Overdosage of the prescribed medication can have serious consequences.
meanings.sent2: The nurse quickly responded to the patient's overdosage of painkillers.
meanings.sent3: The children's game involved pretending to experience overdosage of imaginary potions.
meanings.sent4: In her excitement, she committed an overdosage of glitter to the craft project.
meanings.sent5: The warning label clearly stated the risks of overdosage on the bottle.
